arts.sum: The Champions League group stage has concluded with mixed fortunes for Italian clubs. Inter Milan emerged as the sole Italian representative directly qualifying for the Round of 16, finishing an impressive fourth in the overall standings. arts.ttl: “We Didn’t Deserve to Win”: Motta’s Candid Assessment of Juventus’ Champions League Defeat
arts.sum: Juventus manager Thiago Motta offered a frank evaluation of his team's performance following their loss to Benfica in the final match of the Champions League group stage. The defeat, which drew criticism from fans at the Allianz Stadium, left Motta with no illusions about his team's shortcomings. arts.ttl: Brilliant Benfica shut out Juventus to reach play-offs
arts.sum: Benfica confirm their place in the knockout play-off round of the Champions League with a convincing 2-0 win over Juventus on matchday eight of the group phase at the Allianz Stadium.

arts.ttl: Injury Woes Continue for Juventus as Kalulu Exits Champions League Clash
arts.sum: In a significant setback for Juventus, defender Pierre Kalulu was forced to leave the field during their crucial Champions League match against Benfica due to a muscle injury. The incident occurred early in the game, adding to the mounting defensive concerns for manager Thiago Motta. arts.ttl: Benfica beat Juventus 2-0 in Italy to progress in the Champions League
arts.sum: Benfica’s UEFA Champions League campaign will continue in the play-offs after a 2-0 win against Juventus in Turin. The Eagles took the lead in the 16th minute when Fredrik Aursnes picked out Alexander Bah, the defender squaring the ball to Vangelis Pavlidis who beat Mattia Perin. Francisco Conceição tried hard to inspire the Serie A side but they continually gave the ball away in their own half, Perin doing well to deny Pavlidis on the stroke of half-time. Juventus started the second half strong but were unable to beat Anatolii Trubin, their best chance falling to Douglas Luiz who couldn't beat the Ukrainian goalkeeper. Benfica doubled their advantage in the 80th minute when Kerem Aktürkoglu left Pavlidis’ pass for Orkun Kökçü, the Turk picking up the ball and placing it into the bottom corner. It was a vital victory for Bruno Lage and his team who ended up 16th on the table. They will face Monaco or Brest in the knockout phase play-offs, the winners to take on Barcelona or Liverpool in the Round of 16.

arts.ttl: Champions League | Juventus 0-2 Benfica: Match Report
arts.sum: Juventus’ Champions League campaign took a significant hit as they suffered a 2-0 home defeat to Benfica, potentially complicating their path in the upcoming play-offs. The Turin giants, already assured of a play-off spot, now find themselves in a precarious position due to a string of underwhelming performances. The match at the Allianz Stadium saw Juventus struggle from the outset. Despite early chances, including a close header from Samuel Mbangula, the home side failed to capitalize. Their woes were compounded when Pierre Kalulu was forced off due to injury, disrupting their defensive setup.
